If an absolute directory was used for initializing the object of 
(class I=
dealGasMix) for VC project, such as:
$-------------------------------------=
----------------------
$
$	IdealGasMix gas("C:\\Air.cti", "air");
$
$------=
-----------------------------------------------------

while running the pr=
ogram, an exception will be throwned out like 
this:
$---------------------=
--------------------------------------
$     Procedure: get_XML_File
$     =
Error:     cannot open ./c:\Air.xml for reading.Note, 
$               this=
 error indicates a possible configuration problem.
$-----------------------=
------------------------------------


After a thorough study for the sourc=
e code, the reason causing the 
exception was ascribed to file "misc.cpp"
F=
or the file "win32\Cantera\src\misc.cpp", it looks as follow :
$-----------=
-----------------------------------------------

$    string::size_type isl=
ash =3D path.rfind('/'); //!!the problem 
$     if (islash !=3D string::npo=
s) 
$         ff =3D string("./")+path.substr(islash+1,idot-
islash - 1) + =
".xml";
$     else {
$         ff =3D string("./")+path.substr(0,idot) + ".=
xml";
$       }
$----------------------------------------------------------=


For windows platform, the directory splitter is a backslash ('\'), 
while=
 for Unix like system it's a solidus('/').
So the source code needs to be p=
athed as follow:
$---------------------------------------------------------=
--
$	#ifdef WIN32
$	  string::size_type islash =3D path.rfind('\\');
$	#els=
e
$	  tring::size_type islash =3D path.rfind('/');
$	#endif    	
$       if=
 (islash !=3D string::npos) 
$            ff =3D string("./")+path.substr(i=
slash+1,idot-
islash - 1) + ".xml";
$        else {
$            ff =3D str=
ing("./")+path.substr(0,idot) + ".xml";
$        }
$-----------------------=
------------------------------------
